chart_description: The `chrony.skew` chart displays the time difference between the local system clock and the reference clock, expressed in parts per million (ppm). Skew is one of the parameters used by Chrony, a network time synchronization software, to determine the offset and accuracy of the system clock.

dimension_descriptions.skew: The difference between the local system clock and the reference clock, expressed in parts per million (ppm). A positive skew means the local clock is running too fast, while a negative skew means it is running too slow. The magnitude of the skew represents the amount of adjustment required to synchronize the clocks.
